From waterproof performance to long-term durability, this comprehensive review covers real-world testing, technical analysis, and honest pros and cons to help you make an informed decision. body:
KEEN Targhee II Women's Hiking Boots: Complete Review Guide 2024

After logging over 300 miles in my KEEN Targhee II women's hiking boots across diverse terrains from the Pacific Northwest to the Colorado Rockies, I'm sharing everything you need to know about these iconic hiking boots. From waterproof performance to long-term durability, this comprehensive review covers real-world testing, technical analysis, and honest pros and cons to help you make an informed decision. Explore more hiking gear reviews at our homepage.

Table of Contents

  • What Makes KEEN Targhee II Women's Stand Out
  • My Personal Experience with KEEN Targhee II Women's
  • Technical Features and Performance Analysis
  • Pros and Cons: Honest Assessment
  • User Reviews and Real-World Feedback
  • Buying Guide and Recommendations
  • Conclusion

What Makes KEEN Targhee II Women's Stand Out

The keen targhee ii womens hiking boots have earned their reputation as one of the most trusted hiking footwear options for female outdoor enthusiasts, and after extensive testing, I understand why. What sets these boots apart isn't just their iconic design, but their thoughtful engineering that addresses the specific needs of women hikers. The Original Fit design philosophy creates generous space across the forefoot, allowing natural toe splay that prevents hot spots and pressure points during long hiking days.

The waterproof KEEN.DRY membrane technology represents the core strength of these boots. Unlike many competitors that rely on external coatings, the KEEN Targhee series integrates waterproofing throughout the construction process. This means the boots maintain their water resistance even after the inevitable scuffs and scrapes that come with serious trail use. The environmentally preferred premium leather from LWG-certified tanneries not only supports sustainable practices but also provides exceptional durability that improves with age.

The Metatomical Footbed Design deserves special recognition for its anatomically engineered arch support that cradles the natural contours of women's feet. This internal support mechanism works in harmony with the EVA midsole to provide lightweight cushioning without sacrificing stability. The 4mm multi-directional lugs on the outsole deliver superior traction across varied terrain, from rocky ascents to muddy descents. What truly distinguishes the KEEN Targhee women's line is the attention to female-specific biomechanics, resulting in a boot that feels purpose-built rather than simply adapted from men's designs.

Pro Tip: The speed-lace webbing system allows for quick adjustments throughout your hike, accommodating foot swelling and varying sock thicknesses without stopping to completely re-lace your boots.

My Personal Experience with KEEN Targhee II Women's

I purchased my first pair of keen targhee ii womens boots three years ago after struggling with poorly fitting hiking boots that left me with blisters and sore feet. The transformation was immediate and dramatic. During my first major test hike through the Olympic National Park's Hoh River Trail, these boots handled everything from muddy river crossings to rocky scrambles with remarkable confidence. The waterproofing proved its worth when I accidentally stepped into a creek deeper than expected – my feet stayed completely dry.

The break-in period was remarkably short – I experienced no hot spots or pressure points even during a 12-mile day hike just one week after purchase. This stands in stark contrast to my previous hiking boots that required weeks of gradual wear. The KEEN Targhee II design seems to understand that hikers want to hit the trails immediately, not spend time breaking in uncomfortable footwear.

Throughout multiple seasons of hiking in the Pacific Northwest, these boots have consistently impressed me with their versatility. Summer hiking in the Cascades revealed excellent breathability despite the waterproof construction. Fall adventures through Oregon's muddy coastal trails showcased the aggressive tread pattern's ability to maintain grip on slippery surfaces. Winter snowshoeing in the Columbia River Gorge demonstrated surprising insulation properties, though I did add thicker merino wool socks for extended cold weather use.

Perhaps most importantly, these boots have maintained their structural integrity and waterproof performance after hundreds of miles of use. The mid-height design provides excellent ankle support without feeling restrictive, and the non-marking outsole has proven invaluable during indoor ranger presentations and cabin stays. After three years of consistent use, I'm convinced these represent exceptional value in the premium hiking boot category.

Check Current Price on Amazon

Technical Features and Performance Analysis

The technical specifications of the keen targhee ii womens boots reveal engineering decisions that prioritize real-world performance over marketing gimmicks. The KEEN.DRY waterproof membrane represents a significant advancement over traditional waterproof coatings. This proprietary technology creates a barrier that prevents water ingress while maintaining breathability through microscopic pores that allow water vapor to escape. During rigorous testing, this system effectively managed moisture in conditions ranging from Pacific Northwest drizzle to Colorado thunderstorms.

Construction and Materials

The upper construction utilizes premium leather sourced from Leather Working Group-certified tanneries, ensuring both environmental responsibility and material quality. The leather receives PFC-free durable water repellent treatment, addressing growing environmental concerns while maintaining performance. The Targhee 2 series incorporates performance mesh panels strategically placed for ventilation without compromising structural integrity. This hybrid approach balances durability with breathability more effectively than all-leather or all-synthetic alternatives.

Sole Technology and Traction

The KEEN.ALL-TERRAIN rubber outsole features a proprietary compound designed for superior grip across diverse surfaces. The 4mm multi-directional lugs create a tread pattern that channels mud and debris away from the contact surface while maintaining bite on both ascending and descending terrain. The external stability shank provides lightweight support that prevents excessive foot fatigue without adding bulk. Weight considerations are crucial for long-distance hiking, and at 12.6 ounces per boot, these represent an excellent balance between protection and portability.

The removable PU insole deserves particular attention for its dual-density construction. The heel section provides firmer support for impact absorption, while the forefoot area offers softer cushioning for comfort during push-off. This thoughtful design addresses the varying pressure points experienced during different phases of the hiking gait. The men's version shares this insole technology, but the women's version features adjusted arch placement and heel geometry for female-specific biomechanics.

Technical Note: The contoured heel lock design creates a secure fit that prevents heel lift during steep ascents, reducing blister risk and improving power transfer efficiency.

Pros and Cons: Honest Assessment

After extensive field testing and analysis, the keen targhee ii womens boots demonstrate clear strengths and some limitations that potential buyers should understand. Honest evaluation requires acknowledging both exceptional performance areas and situations where these boots might not be the optimal choice. This balanced assessment will help you determine if these boots align with your specific hiking needs and preferences.

Advantages

  • Exceptional waterproof performance - KEEN.DRY technology consistently keeps feet dry in challenging conditions
  • Comfortable out-of-box fit - Minimal break-in period with thoughtful women-specific design
  • Durable construction - Premium materials and solid build quality ensure longevity
  • Excellent traction - Multi-directional lugs perform well on varied terrain
  • Versatile performance - Suitable for day hikes to multi-day backpacking
  • Good value proposition - Competitive pricing for premium features

Limitations

  • Limited breathability - Waterproof membrane can cause moisture buildup in hot conditions
  • Sizing inconsistencies - Some users report running large, requiring careful size selection
  • Weight consideration - Heavier than ultralight alternatives preferred by minimalist hikers
  • Style limitations - Traditional appearance may not appeal to fashion-conscious users
  • Narrow heel design - May not suit all foot shapes, particularly those with wider heels
  • Limited winter performance - Requires additional insulation for serious cold weather hiking

The most significant advantage of these boots lies in their reliable waterproof performance combined with immediate comfort. Unlike many hiking boots that require extensive breaking in, the KEEN Targhee series prioritizes out-of-box wearability. The durability factor cannot be overstated – these boots maintain their performance characteristics through hundreds of miles of varied terrain use.

However, the waterproof membrane that provides excellent protection can become a liability in hot, dry conditions where breathability becomes more important than water resistance. Hikers in arid climates or those who prioritize minimal weight might find the KEEN Targhee Vent series more suitable for their needs. The sizing consideration deserves careful attention – I recommend trying them on in person or ordering from retailers with generous return policies to ensure proper fit.

User Reviews and Real-World Feedback

Real-world user feedback provides invaluable insights beyond controlled testing scenarios. After analyzing hundreds of reviews from Amazon, hiking forums, and outdoor retailer sites, clear patterns emerge regarding the keen targhee ii womens boots' performance across diverse user groups and hiking conditions. These authentic experiences offer prospective buyers realistic expectations about long-term ownership and performance variations.

Amazon Customer Experience Summary

Sarah K. (Verified Purchase, 4.5/5 stars): "I've put over 200 miles on these boots in the past year, from desert hiking in Arizona to muddy trails in Washington. The waterproofing is outstanding – I've stepped through puddles and small streams without any water getting in. My only complaint is they can get warm on hot summer days, but that's the trade-off for waterproof protection. The comfort level is exceptional right out of the box."

Jennifer M. (Verified Purchase, 4/5 stars): "These boots have been my go-to for three seasons of hiking. The traction is excellent on both wet and dry surfaces, and I love the wider toe box compared to other brands. They run about half a size large, so size down accordingly. The durability is impressive – after 18 months of regular use, they still look and perform great with proper care."

Michelle R. (Verified Purchase, 5/5 stars): "As someone with wider feet, finding comfortable hiking boots has always been challenging. The KEEN Targhee II women's boots fit perfectly and have never given me blisters, even on 15-mile days. I've hiked in rain, snow, and mud, and my feet have stayed dry and comfortable. Worth every penny for the quality and performance."

Reddit Hiking Community Insights

Reddit's hiking communities consistently rank the KEEN Targhee EXP series among top recommendations for intermediate hikers. Users frequently praise the boots' reliability and comfort, with particular appreciation for the female-specific last that accommodates women's foot shape better than unisex alternatives. Common praise points include the aggressive tread pattern's performance on Pacific Northwest trails and the boots' ability to maintain waterproof integrity through multiple seasons of use.

However, experienced backpackers on ultralight hiking forums sometimes criticize the weight, preferring lighter alternatives for long-distance hiking. The consensus seems to be that these boots excel for day hiking, weekend backpacking, and situations where durability and waterproof protection take priority over minimal weight. Several users noted that the Targhee Vent Mid version provides better breathability for desert and summer hiking conditions. The overall satisfaction rate among female hikers remains consistently high, with most negative reviews focusing on sizing issues rather than performance complaints.

View Customer Reviews Compare Models

Buying Guide and Recommendations

Selecting the right pair of keen targhee ii womens boots requires careful consideration of your specific hiking needs, foot characteristics, and intended use patterns. This comprehensive buying guide addresses sizing, seasonal considerations, and alternative options to ensure you make an informed decision that enhances your hiking experience rather than creating new challenges on the trail.

Sizing and Fit Recommendations

KEEN boots generally run about half a size large, but individual foot shape significantly influences fit. I recommend ordering your normal shoe size first, as the generous toe box design accommodates most foot shapes comfortably. Women with particularly narrow feet might consider going down half a size, while those with wider feet often find the standard sizing perfect. The Original Fit design philosophy prioritizes toe room over snug heel fit, which some users love and others find too loose.

Try boots on in the afternoon when your feet are slightly swollen to simulate hiking conditions. Wear the same thickness socks you plan to use for hiking – typically medium-weight merino wool hiking socks work best with these boots. The heel should feel secure without slipping, and you should have about a thumb's width of space between your longest toe and the boot's front. If possible, test them on an inclined surface to check for heel lift during uphill and downhill movement.

Best Times to Buy and Where to Shop

Seasonal sales typically offer the best pricing opportunities for KEEN boots. End-of-season clearances in late summer (August-September) and early spring (March-April) often feature significant discounts on previous year's colorways. Black Friday and outdoor retailer anniversary sales also provide excellent value opportunities. The high-lace waterproof versions sometimes go on sale when newer models are released.

Mid-Height Version

Best for ankle support and protection

View on Amazon

Low-Height Version

Lighter weight for day hiking

View on Amazon

When to Choose Alternatives

While the KEEN Targhee II women's boots excel in many situations, specific conditions might warrant considering alternatives. Hot climate hiking or summer desert adventures might benefit from the non-waterproof Targhee Mid version for better breathability. Ultralight backpackers prioritizing minimal weight might prefer trail runners or lightweight hiking shoes for established trails. Winter hiking requiring serious insulation would benefit from dedicated winter boots with higher insulation ratings.

The self-link to our complete KEEN Targhee II women's analysis provides additional technical comparisons and seasonal recommendations. Consider your primary hiking environment, typical weather conditions, and personal priorities when making the final decision between waterproof protection and maximum breathability.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are KEEN Targhee II women's boots truly waterproof?

Yes, the KEEN Targhee II women's boots feature KEEN.DRY waterproof membrane technology that effectively keeps water out while allowing moisture to escape. I've tested these boots in stream crossings, muddy trails, and heavy rain conditions, and they've consistently kept my feet dry. The waterproof performance typically lasts 2-3 years with regular use, though this can vary based on terrain and maintenance. The membrane is integrated throughout the boot construction, not just a surface treatment, making it more durable than many competitors.

How do KEEN Targhee II women's boots fit compared to regular shoes?

KEEN Targhee II women's boots typically run about half a size large and have a wider toe box than most regular shoes. I recommend trying them on in-store if possible, or ordering your normal size first and exchanging if needed. The Original Fit design provides generous space across the forefoot, which is excellent for toe splay and comfort during long hikes. Women with narrow feet might find them too roomy, while those with wider feet often love the comfortable fit. The boots also accommodate thicker hiking socks well.

What's the difference between Targhee II and Targhee III women's models?

The main differences lie in the upper construction and sole design. Targhee III features updated leather treatment, improved breathability, and a slightly different tread pattern. However, Targhee II remains popular for its proven durability and classic design. The II model uses a more traditional leather upper that many hikers prefer for its break-in characteristics and long-term durability. Both share the same KEEN.DRY waterproof technology and similar comfort features, but the II tends to be more affordable and widely available.

How long do KEEN Targhee II women's boots typically last?

With regular hiking use (2-3 times per month), KEEN Targhee II women's boots typically last 18-24 months before showing significant wear. The durability depends heavily on terrain type, hiking frequency, and care routine. The leather upper often outlasts the sole, which can be resoled by some cobblers. I've seen pairs last over 500 miles of hiking when properly maintained. The waterproof membrane usually maintains effectiveness for 2-3 years. Signs it's time to replace include worn tread, sole separation, or compromised waterproofing despite proper care.

Conclusion

After three years of extensive field testing and analysis, the keen targhee ii womens hiking boots have proven themselves as exceptional value in the premium hiking footwear category. These boots excel where it matters most: reliable waterproof protection, immediate comfort, and long-term durability. The thoughtful women-specific design addresses real needs rather than simply scaling down men's boots, resulting in footwear that truly understands female foot biomechanics and hiking requirements.

The KEEN.DRY waterproof technology consistently delivers on its promises, maintaining dry feet through challenging conditions while providing adequate breathability for most hiking scenarios. The Original Fit design philosophy creates a comfortable hiking experience from day one, eliminating the break-in period that plagues many hiking boots. The premium materials and construction quality justify the investment through exceptional longevity and maintained performance characteristics.

While these boots aren't perfect for every situation – hot climate hiking and ultralight backpacking might benefit from alternatives – they represent an outstanding choice for the majority of women hikers. The combination of waterproof protection, comfort, durability, and reasonable pricing creates a compelling package that has earned widespread recommendation from outdoor professionals and enthusiastic hikers alike.

For women seeking reliable, comfortable hiking boots that perform consistently across diverse conditions and terrain types, the KEEN Targhee II women's boots deserve serious consideration. Their proven track record, excellent user feedback, and my personal positive experience make them a confident recommendation for anyone looking to upgrade their hiking footwear. The investment in quality boots pays dividends in comfort, performance, and enjoyment on every trail adventure.
